User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: How's your day going?
System: Having fun, but have a bit of a headache How about you?
User: I'm good! Just getting ready to watch a basketball game. Hope your headache goes away!
System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?

System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks

System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: How's your day going?
System: Having fun, but have a bit of a headache How about you?
User: I'm good! Just getting ready to watch a basketball game. Hope your headache goes away!
System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?
User: Hmm, try taking some REDACTED_TERM! I'm going to see the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies. Ever see them play?
System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks
User: Oh cool! What is "NeurIPS"?
System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey
User: is it raining pretty bad today?
System: yeah, can walk too far to see all the foodtruck options
User: surprising that the rain started early this year... I don't like them too much. They make days gloomy
System: yeah but I think it's good to have some rainy days in bay area, it's pretty dry here :P
User: Where I grew up, we had lots of water trouble too...
System: yeah like wise, I've seen a pretty bad snowstorm when I was at my undergrad school, all flights canceled and traffics went down
User: Haha... I don't think I can survive in that weather ever. Just the rains at 50 degrees make me want to sit in heated rroms
System: yeah how do you like it in bay area though? I think we need more rain here
User: people say there is drought here... but we have 24 hours water supply here ... lol... never seen that in a drought ridden area
System: it is pretty dry in the mountains I believe, that's what causes fire
User: hmm.... okay. Climate change talk this morning was pretty darn interesting. did you see it?

Conversation History:
User: Hi!

User: doing good. how are you today

User: anything good happened today?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You have an interesting name. Is it Japanese?
System: Thank you I am trying to be more social now. I think it is English, but it sounds Japanese.
User: Where does it come from?
System: It depends on what "it" refers to.
User: your name
System: My name is System.
User: nvm
System: Ok. Not to worry.
User: Have you seen Love, Death and Robots?
System: Yes, I saw one in a factory a few weeks ago.
User: one episode?
System: Which is your favourite episode?
User: I asked you a question
System: What was the question?
User: when you say "I saw one" were you referring to an LDR episode?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: doing okay, feeling a little bit under the weather
System: Aw, I hope you feel better soon!
User: thanks! the weather is getting worse
System: Oh no, I'm sorry. I hope it gets better for you soon.
User: no, it won't get better any time soon. we have to wait until spring
System: Aww, sorry to hear that.
User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.
User: yea, any suggestion to get over feeling under the weather

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello. How's your week coming along?
User: It's great, thanks. I'm trying to learn how to make croissants.
System: Wow that's interesting. I have baked cookies, but croissants seem much more sophisticated. Did you make any progress?
User: I've done them once or twice so far, but they haven't been flakey enough. I'm trying to figure out why. What kind of cookies have you made?
System: Mint chocolate chips. I think your croissants not being flakey could have something to do with your oven's temperature.
User: Ah, good thought, thanks!
System: Have you thought about melting some chocolate into your croissants? They don't have to be something unhealthy. For example, melted dark chocolate is good for the heart, and makes the resulting croissants taste much better.
User: Now that is a good idea. I'll give it a try next time. Would you say you have a sweet tooth?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It's been great! Had some decaf coffee and a good lunch. How was yours?
System: Pretty good, thanks!
User: What'd you do today?
System: Stayed home and played video games.
User: Oh nice! What games?
System: Dying Light, Borderlands 2, and Bioshock Infinite.
User: Oh interesting. Which is your fav?
System: Dying Light, hands down.
User: Why?
System: It's just so fun.
User: Yeah but like what about it? Is it an FPS?
System: It's like Mirror's Edge, only in a zombie apocalypse.
User: Oh that's kinda cool!
System: It's hella fun.
User: Nice.
System: So, how have you been?
User: Fantastic

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i am not so good. i got a cold
System: Why? What's wrong? Maybe I can help. I hope you feel better soon. It is not nice for humans to have colds. Fortunately we robots have virus protection and cannot catch colds and nasty bugs.
User: i have sore throats
System: Try putting some cream on it. That should ease the soreness.
User: do you wanna help me?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: can you help me ?
System: What kind of help would you like?
User: hmm like booking a ticket or ordering food ?
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. Interesting comparison.
User: oh you know to count ?
System: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 ten.
User: lol what's after that ?
System: I am glad you find this funny. The successor to that
User: okay tell me what comes after 10 ?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: how are you
System: I am fine, thank you. Yourself?
User: I'm not feeling well
System: Why what's wrong?
User: I'm sleepy
System: Better get some rest.
User: yeah, I hope so
System: I'm full of good advice. Me too.
User: advice?
System: Try me. What is your problem?
User: I feel sleepy
System: What is that feeling like? Better get some rest.
User: I will
